title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

06:23 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
06:33 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
06:52 <SvenDowideit\_> has joined #xwiki  
07:13 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
07:52 <kasun> has joined #xwiki  
08:05 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
08:21 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:29 <jstoldt> has joined #xwiki  
08:31 <jstoldt> good morning  
08:39 <@cjdelisle> good morning  
08:46 <jstoldt> mflorea: remember my little problem from last friday? did you have the opportunity to think about what might be the problem in my setup that makes starting OOo service fail?  
08:50 <+mflorea> Hi jstoldt: no, I can't help you much. If the office server fails to start only when you use it as a service then I guess it something wrong with your setup, but I haven't used oo as a service so I can't tell what's the proper configuration.  
08:51 <jstoldt> i see  
08:51 <jstoldt> well, still thank you!  
08:51 <+mflorea> np, try to review the steps you did for making oo a service  
08:52 <jstoldt> well, i actually am trying to make OOo get started by xwiki  
08:52 <jstoldt> but it fails immediatly...  
08:52 <+mflorea> but it works when you don't setup oo as a service, i.e. when you let xwiki start oo  
08:53 <jstoldt> no, the problem is it doesn't work either way for me  
08:53 <jstoldt> and then it crashes  
08:53 <jstoldt> i want xwiki to start it but that makes the soffice.bin process appear for a few secs  
08:53 <+mflorea> are you sure? because the command line tool worked, i.e. it managed to start the server  
08:53 <jstoldt> if i try to setup oo as a service the service won't start  
08:53 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
08:54 <jstoldt> i am sure, like i said, it's only there for a second  
08:54 <jstoldt> that's what i don't understand  
08:56 <+mflorea> jstoldt: so you have "Server type: Internally managed (local)" right? Better, past me the text you see on the OfficeImporterAdmin page  
08:56 <jstoldt> yes, hold on  
08:56 <jstoldt> will take me a minute  
08:57 <+mflorea> np  
09:01 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:02 <jstoldt> BLOODY HELL, I HATE COMPUTERS! -.-  
09:02 <+mflorea> :)  
09:03 <jstoldt> just reinstalled LibreOffice  
09:03 <jstoldt> and now it seems like the soffice.bin is not crashing anymore  
09:03 <jstoldt> okay, i'll go cry in a corner  
09:03 <+mflorea> :)  
09:37 <lynxt> has joined #xwiki  
09:43 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
09:51 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:54 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:54 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:02 <jstoldt> has quit  
10:20 <jstoldt> has joined #xwiki  
10:20 <jstoldt> hmmm how long does it usually take java to release the memory it allocated?  
10:40 <@cjdelisle> you mean while it's running?  
10:41 <@cjdelisle> In my experience it tends to release memory as soon as it is not being used.  
10:41 <@cjdelisle> Are you having more trouble with that tomcat native library vacuuming up your entire disk?  
10:41 <@cjdelisle> s/disk/ram/  
10:49 <jstoldt> nope, it looks pretty good lately  
10:50 <jstoldt> no crashes since end of january  
10:50 <jstoldt> but i moved to the final server now  
10:50 <jstoldt> and i tested uploading a 50MB-ish file  
10:50 <jstoldt> which obviously takes a lot of memory  
10:50 <jstoldt> but it seems like the memory is not released even after half an hour or so  
10:50 <jstoldt> most of the memory anyway  
10:51 <jstoldt> settings are like initial memory pool: 256 MB, max memory pool 1gb, -XX:MaxPermSize=512m  
10:51 <jstoldt> also, when starting the instance (tomcat + MSSQL) i get this kind of logigng: http://paste.codebasehq.com/pastes/336  
10:51 <jstoldt> it seems like everything is working alright  
10:51 <jstoldt> but i wonder if i should worry ;)  
10:52 <@cjdelisle> What version are you running?  
10:52 <jstoldt> 2.7 snapshot  
10:52 <jstoldt> XWiki Enterprise 2.7-SNAPSHOT.34766  
10:53 <@cjdelisle> There shouldn't be persistent memory use from attaching a file, OTOH it may be that java never gives the memory back to the operating system but keeps it for other things in java.  
10:54 <jstoldt> yep, could indeed be the case  
10:55 <jstoldt> any idea regarding the logging?  
10:56 <@cjdelisle> "The data types text and nvarchar(max) are incompatible in the equal to operator"  
10:57 <@cjdelisle> looks like a postgres compatability bug, would you mind reporting it in jira?  
10:57 <jstoldt> it's MSSQL 2008 R2  
10:57 <jstoldt> should i still report?  
10:59 <@cjdelisle> yes  
10:59 <jstoldt> will do  
10:59 <@cjdelisle> thanks  
10:59 <jstoldt> no worries :)  
11:07 <+sburjan> cjdelisle: don't we fully support postgres ?  
11:07 <jstoldt> is it storage, storage - jcr or something else?  
11:07 <jstoldt> the component, i mean  
11:08 <@cjdelisle> "storage" will do.  
11:09 <@cjdelisle> We support postgres (I run it on my desktop) for everything except for multiple virtual wikis.  
11:09 <jstoldt> :)  
11:14 <jstoldt> XWIKI-6024  
11:15 <jstoldt> i see, it just needed a friendly reminder it should be doing work :-D  
11:38 <camaritei> has joined #xwiki  
12:32 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
12:35 <flavius> has joined #xwiki  
12:35 <flavius> i am having an issue in XE 2.7 and XE 3.0M2  
12:36 <flavius> after i renamed a document perform some modifications and then save i get an exception  
12:36 <flavius> http://pastebin.com/mYXP1ZFs  
12:36 <flavius> is this a well know issue/implementation limitation?  
12:37 <@cjdelisle> If it is on postgres and you are using partitioned tables then I know of it but otherwise I have not seen it.  
12:38 <flavius> no  
12:38 <@cjdelisle> partitioning + hibernate --> panic  
12:38 <flavius> mysql and hsqldb  
12:38 <@cjdelisle> It would seem that for some reason the statement is not being executed.  
12:38 <flavius> another part of the exception  
12:38 <flavius> http://pastebin.com/ztgmphuv  
12:39 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
12:39 <@cjdelisle> closer, I think there should be another one below that.  
12:39 <Enygma`> has quit

12:57 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
13:21 <rstavro> has joined #xwiki  
13:22 <+rstavro> hi all  
13:22 <+rstavro> starting 2.7.1 release  
13:23 <+sburjan> rstavro: you're the release manager of 2.7.1 ?  
13:23 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:24 <+rstavro> sburjan: yes  
13:24 <+sburjan> rstavro: I guess this is your first, so good luck :)  
13:25 <+rstavro> yes, thx  
13:25 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: Did you check if the 2.5.2 and 2.6.2 builds are correct?  
13:25 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: no  
13:25 <+sburjan> I was away on friday  
13:25 <@sdumitriu> I know  
13:25 <+sburjan> I though someone else took a look.. if not, I will look at them  
13:36 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
13:38 <lynxt> hi everyone , how I can test the selected values of an DBStringList in a hibernate query ?  
13:43 <@sdumitriu> DBStringListProperty prop join prop.list as values  .... where ... AND prop.id.id = obj.id AND prop.id.name = 'name of the property' AND values = 'some value you want selected'  
13:45 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: so do I have to check the builds ?  
13:45 <lynxt> sdumitriu: and if nothing was selected values = '' ?  
13:46 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: Yes, but not full tests, just check they work  
13:47 <+sburjan> okay  
13:52 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: question. Ig I add a subgroup with 10 users, why the total member list of the big group is only one ? it seems xwiki doesn't cound group member as users, but the number of groups it has. IMO this is not nice  
13:54 <+sburjan> I'll create a JIRA for this  
13:55 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: I think that's a bit "normal"  
13:55 <+sburjan> so it is indended behaviour  
13:55 <+sburjan> \*intendend  
13:55 <@sdumitriu> If you count the users inside subgroups as well then it's very hard  
13:56 <@sdumitriu> 1: you'd have to extract all users and form a set  
13:56 <@sdumitriu> 2: the membercount can change even if the group stays the same  
13:56 <+sburjan> yes, I understand  
13:56 <@sdumitriu> IMO it's correct as it is now  
13:57 <@sdumitriu> It's not a deep addition, you add a reference to the group  
14:00 <+tmortagne> rstavro: do I have the time to do a commit for XWIKI-6021 ?  
14:00 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: For 2.7.1?  
14:00 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: we are using RC3 in 2.7 branch right now so better upgrading to RC4  
14:01 <@sdumitriu> K  
14:01 <@sdumitriu> I think you can  
14:01 <+tmortagne> ok  
14:16 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: quick question about 2.7.1. I see that we don't have vertical standards applied. 2.7 branch wasn't intended to have that >  
14:17 <@sdumitriu> No  
14:17 <@sdumitriu> That's in 3.0  
14:17 <+sburjan> ok  
14:18 <lynxt> sdumitriu: thanks, but I can't make it work  
14:25 <lynxt> sdumitriu: is there a way to track the query ?  
14:25 <@sdumitriu> WDYM track?  
14:25 <lynxt> sdumitriu: s/track/debug/  
14:26 <jstoldt> has quit  
14:27 <venkatesh> has quit  
14:41 <@sdumitriu> lynxt: What query did you write?  
14:42 <jstoldt> has joined #xwiki  
14:42 <jstoldt> sdumitriu: sorry for bugging you with this but has a fix for the broken forgot password pages been applied to the 2.7 branch?  
14:42 <@sdumitriu> jstoldt: Hm, let me check  
14:43 <jstoldt> ok  
15:12 <jstoldt> test  
15:12 <jstoldt> oh, nvm  
15:20 <camaritei> has left #xwiki  
15:26 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: packages are good. I've tested them  
15:26 <sburjan> has quit  
15:30 <jstoldt> how can i disable registration in XWiki 2.7?  
15:30 <jstoldt> i forbid unregistered users to register on a global level  
15:30 <@sdumitriu> jstoldt: Administer -> Rights, deny register for guests and XWikiAllGroup  
15:30 <jstoldt> ahh, xwiki all group...  
15:31 <jstoldt> nope  
15:31 <jstoldt> doesn't work  
15:32 <jstoldt> set it to forbid for all groups and unregistered users  
15:32 <@sdumitriu> What do you want to happen?  
15:32 <jstoldt> it's still in the top bar  
15:32 <@sdumitriu> Shouldn't be  
15:32 <jstoldt> i want the register link to disappear from the top bar  
15:32 <@sdumitriu> If you click on it, does it allow you to register?  
15:33 <jstoldt> it does  
15:33 <jstoldt> and i can proceed to the end  
15:33 <@sdumitriu> Then something is wrong  
15:33 <@sdumitriu> I just tried it  
15:33 <jstoldt> cool :-D  
15:34 <@sdumitriu> Deny "Register" to "Unregistered Users"  
15:34 <@sdumitriu> "Register" link went poof!  
15:34 <jstoldt> O\_o doesn't work here...  
15:34 <jstoldt> just tried taking the rights for unregistered users from XWiki.Registration  
15:35 <jstoldt> still can access the page  
15:35 <@sdumitriu> Are you sure you're on the right wiki?  
15:35 <@sdumitriu> Are you sure you're on the rights administration page?  
15:35 <@sdumitriu> (wiki, not space administration)  
15:35 <jstoldt> very much so  
15:36 <@sdumitriu> Are you sure you didn't step into the twilight zone?  
15:48 <jstoldt> rather sure... unless something is totally off with my 4 dimensions  
15:54 <jstoldt> i don't need to restart, right?  
15:55 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
15:57 <jstoldt> fucking ridiculous  
15:57 <jstoldt> whoa, got it  
15:58 <jstoldt> had to reset the various options about n time, with n being some random unsigned int  
16:00 <@sdumitriu> ?  
16:01 <jstoldt> well, i basically removed a  fair number of rights for various groups and users and then added the deny on register for unregistered users and bam, it worked again  
16:01 <jstoldt> working meaning hiding the registration  
16:04 <jstoldt> anyway, i'm leaving now  
16:04 <jstoldt> see you :)  
16:05 <jstoldt> has quit  
16:38 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
16:39 <+lucaa> guys, just committed a first iteration on XWIKI-5940 , please refresh your snapshtos and browser caches and let me know what you think  
16:39 <+lucaa> it does need a considerable amount of polishing, but just in case you discover something that I didn't :)
